Badges API Reference

Each ServiceStack Route will be listed with it's Return Type, which Verbs (aka Methods) are allowed to be used with it, the url path for the endpoint, notes entered by the developer in the code, a summary of the purpose of the endpoint, the data that the endpoint can take in (parameters) as well as the Return Type's properties (if an object model) and an example of how to call it in TypeScript.

CheckBadgeExistsByID
GET | Returns: int? | Path: /Badges/Badge/Exists/ID/{ID}

Check if this ID exists and return the id if it does (null if it does not)

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
ID int path Yes The identifier for the record to call.

TypeScript Example

var id: number = this.someValue1;
this.cvApi.badges.CheckBadgeExistsByID(id).then(r => {
	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

ClearBadgeCache
DELETE | Returns: bool | Path: /Badges/Badge/ClearCache

Empties the server-side data cache for all badge calls.

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description

TypeScript Example

	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

CreateBadge
POST | Returns: CEFActionResponse<int> | Path: /Badges/Badge/Create

Use to create a new badge.

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
TypeID int body Yes Identifier for the Type of this Account, required if no TypeModel present
Type TypeModel body Yes Model for Type of this Account, required if no TypeID present
TypeKey string body Yes Key for the Type of this Account, read-only
TypeName string body Yes Name for the Type of this Account, read-only
TypeDisplayName string body No Display Name for the Type of this object, read-only
TypeTranslationKey string body No Translation Key for the Type of this object, read-only
TypeSortOrder int? body No Sort Order for the Type of this object, read-only
Images List<BadgeImageModel> body No Images for the object, optional
PrimaryImageFileName string body No The primary image from the list of images, or the first image if no primary is set (read-only)
Name string body Yes Name of the object, required, max length 128 characters
Description string body No Description of the object, optional, no max length and ideal for storing long HTML content
ID int body No Identifier of the object (required when submitting Updates, must be blank or 0 for Creates
CustomKey string body No Custom Key of the object, optional when not using an ERP integration, max 128 characters
Active bool body No Whether the object is active. Inactive objects are essentially 'Soft-Deleted'. Ensure you set this to true to keep the object alive!
CreatedDate string body No The original date this object was created. Not required for Creates, will be automatically set
UpdatedDate string body No The last time the object was modified. Not Required for Updates, will be automatically set
Hash long? body No The Hash of the object data points coming from Clarity Connect
SerializableAttributes SerializableAttributes body Yes A dictionary of extending Attributes for the this object

TypeScript Example

var dto = <api.CreateBadgeDto>{
	TypeID: this.someValue1, // number 
	Type: this.someValue2, // TypeModel 
	TypeKey: this.someValue3, // string 
	TypeName: this.someValue4, // string 
	TypeDisplayName: this.someValue5, // string 
	TypeTranslationKey: this.someValue6, // string 
	TypeSortOrder: this.someValue7, // number? 
	Images: this.someValue8, // Array<BadgeImageModel> 
	PrimaryImageFileName: this.someValue9, // string 
	Name: this.someValue10, // string 
	Description: this.someValue11, // string 
	ID: this.someValue12, // number 
	CustomKey: this.someValue13, // string 
	Active: this.someValue14, // boolean 
	CreatedDate: this.someValue15, // string 
	UpdatedDate: this.someValue16, // string 
	Hash: this.someValue17, // number? 
	SerializableAttributes: this.someValue18, // SerializableAttributes 
};
this.cvApi.badges.CreateBadge(dto).then(r => {
	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

	Longitude: this.someValue16, // number?

StoreName string body No The Store Name for objects
StoreSeoUrl string body No The Store SEO URL for objects
BrandID int? Not Set! Not Set! No ApiMember attribute! Please ask a Dev to add an [ApiMember] attribute
Brand BrandModel Not Set! Not Set! No ApiMember attribute! Please ask a Dev to add an [ApiMember] attribute
BrandKey string body No The Brand Custom Key for objects
BrandName string body No The Brand Name for objects
DisplayName string body No Display Name of the object
SortOrder int? body No Sort Order of the object
TranslationKey string body No Display Name of the object
Name string body Yes Name of the object, required, max length 128 characters
Description string body No Description of the object, optional, no max length and ideal for storing long HTML content
ID int body No Identifier of the object (required when submitting Updates, must be blank or 0 for Creates

DeactivateBadgeByID
PATCH | Returns: CEFActionResponse | Path: /Badges/Badge/Deactivate/ID/{ID}

Deactivate a specific badge from the system [Soft-Delete]

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
ID int path Yes The identifier for the record to call.

TypeScript Example

		// Error State
		return;

	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

UpdateBadge
PUT | Returns: CEFActionResponse<int> | Path: /Badges/Badge/Update

Use to update an existing badge.

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
TypeID int body Yes Identifier for the Type of this Account, required if no TypeModel present
Type TypeModel body Yes Model for Type of this Account, required if no TypeID present
TypeKey string body Yes Key for the Type of this Account, read-only
TypeName string body Yes Name for the Type of this Account, read-only
TypeDisplayName string body No Display Name for the Type of this object, read-only
TypeTranslationKey string body No Translation Key for the Type of this object, read-only
TypeSortOrder int? body No Sort Order for the Type of this object, read-only
Images List<BadgeImageModel> body No Images for the object, optional
PrimaryImageFileName string body No The primary image from the list of images, or the first image if no primary is set (read-only)
Name string body Yes Name of the object, required, max length 128 characters
Description string body No Description of the object, optional, no max length and ideal for storing long HTML content
ID int body No Identifier of the object (required when submitting Updates, must be blank or 0 for Creates
CustomKey string body No Custom Key of the object, optional when not using an ERP integration, max 128 characters
Active bool body No Whether the object is active. Inactive objects are essentially 'Soft-Deleted'. Ensure you set this to true to keep the object alive!
CreatedDate string body No The original date this object was created. Not required for Creates, will be automatically set
UpdatedDate string body No The last time the object was modified. Not Required for Updates, will be automatically set
Hash long? body No The Hash of the object data points coming from Clarity Connect
SerializableAttributes SerializableAttributes body Yes A dictionary of extending Attributes for the this object

TypeScript Example

	TypeID: this.someValue1, // number 
	Type: this.someValue2, // TypeModel 
	TypeKey: this.someValue3, // string 
	TypeName: this.someValue4, // string 
	TypeDisplayName: this.someValue5, // string 
	TypeTranslationKey: this.someValue6, // string 
	TypeSortOrder: this.someValue7, // number? 
	Images: this.someValue8, // Array<BadgeImageModel> 
	PrimaryImageFileName: this.someValue9, // string 
	Name: this.someValue10, // string 
	Description: this.someValue11, // string 
	ID: this.someValue12, // number 
	CustomKey: this.someValue13, // string 
	Active: this.someValue14, // boolean 
	CreatedDate: this.someValue15, // string 
	UpdatedDate: this.someValue16, // string 
	Hash: this.someValue17, // number? 
	SerializableAttributes: this.someValue18, // SerializableAttributes 
};
this.cvApi.badges.UpdateBadge(dto).then(r => {
	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

UpsertBadgeImageType
POST | Returns: CEFActionResponse<int> | Path: /Badges/BadgeImageType/Upsert

Use to create a new or update an existing badge image type (as needed).

StoreName string body No The Store Name for objects
StoreSeoUrl string body No The Store SEO URL for objects
BrandID int? Not Set! Not Set! No ApiMember attribute! Please ask a Dev to add an [ApiMember] attribute
Brand BrandModel Not Set! Not Set! No ApiMember attribute! Please ask a Dev to add an [ApiMember] attribute
BrandKey string body No The Brand Custom Key for objects
BrandName string body No The Brand Name for objects
DisplayName string body No Display Name of the object
SortOrder int? body No Sort Order of the object
TranslationKey string body No Display Name of the object
Name string body Yes Name of the object, required, max length 128 characters
Description string body No Description of the object, optional, no max length and ideal for storing long HTML content
ID int body No Identifier of the object (required when submitting Updates, must be blank or 0 for Creates
CustomKey string body No Custom Key of the object, optional when not using an ERP integration, max 128 characters
Active bool body No Whether the object is active. Inactive objects are essentially 'Soft-Deleted'. Ensure you set this to true to keep the object alive!
CreatedDate string body No The original date this object was created. Not required for Creates, will be automatically set
UpdatedDate string body No The last time the object was modified. Not Required for Updates, will be automatically set
Hash long? body No The Hash of the object data points coming from Clarity Connect
SerializableAttributes SerializableAttributes body Yes A dictionary of extending Attributes for the this object
